record.name: Envelope
record.desc: Contains internal IPTC data used formerly in telecommunications. Now it is considered being deprecated and is not widely in use.

tag.name: ModelVersion
tag.desc: A number identifying the version of the Information Interchange Model, Part I, utilised by the provider.
tag.remarks: Version numbers are assigned by IPTC and NAA. The version number of this record is four (4).

tag.name: Destination
tag.desc: This DataSet is to accommodate some providers who require routing information above the appropriate OSI layers.

tag.name: FileFormat
tag.desc: A number representing the file format.
tag.remarks: The file format must be registered with IPTC or NAA with a unique number assigned to it (see Appendix A). The information is used to route the data to the appropriate system and to allow the receiving system to perform the appropriate actions thereto.

enum.name: FileFormats
enum.desc: Registered file formats by IPTC and NAA

item.name: TIFF
item.desc: Tagged Image File Format (Adobe/Aldus Image data) (Recommended for image ObjectData Preview)

item.name: UCOFF
item.desc: IPTC Unstructured Character Oriented File Format (UCOFF)
item.human-name: IPTC Unstructured Character Oriented File Format

item.name: JPEG
item.desc: ¤ JPEG File Interchange (JFIF) (Recommended for image ObjectData Preview)

item.name: BMP
item.desc: ¤ Microsoft Bit Mapped Graphics File [*.BMP] (Recommended for image ObjectData Preview)

item.name: AIFF
item.desc: Audio Interchange File Format AIFF (Apple Computer Inc)

tag.name: FileFormatVersion
tag.desc: A binary number representing the particular version of the

enum.name: FileFormatVersions
enum.desc: File format version registered for NAA and IPTC

item.name: V1
item.desc: Version 1 for file fromat <see cref="FileFormats.NewsphotoParameterRecord"/> and <see cref="FileFormats.NAA89_3"/>, 5.0 for <see cref="FileFormats.TIFF"/>, 1.40 for <see cref="FileFormats.AdobeIllustrator"/>, 2 for <see cref="FileFormats.AppleSingle"/>, 1.02 for <see cref="FileFormats.JPEG"/> and 3.1 for <see cref="FileFormats.Freehand"/>
item.human-name: 1 (IPTC-NAA Digital Newsphoto Parameter Record, NAA 89-3), 5.0 (TIFF), 1.40 (Adobe Illustrator), 2 (Apple Single), 1.02 (JPEG), 3.1 (Freehand)

item.name: V2
item.desc: Version 2 for file format <see cref="FileFormats.NewsphotoParameterRecord"/>, 6.0 for <see cref="FileFormats.TIFF"/>, 4.0 for <see cref="FileFormats.Freehand"/> and 2.0 for <see cref="FileFormats.HTML"/>

item.name: V3
item.desc: Version 3 for file format <see cref="FileFormats.NewsphotoparameterRecord"/> and 5.0 for <see cref="FileFormats.Freehand"/>

item.name: V4
item.desc: Version 4 for file format <see cref="FileFormats.NewsphotoparameterRecord"/> and <see cref="FileFormats.RecommendedMessageFormat"/> and 5.5 for <see cref="FileFormats.Freehand"/>
item.human-name: 4 (IPTC-NAA Digital Newsphoto Parameter Record, Recommended Message Format), 5.5 (Freehand)

tag.name: ServiceIdentifier
tag.desc: Identifies the provider and product.

tag.name: EnvelopeNumber
tag.desc: The characters form a number that will be unique for the date specified in and for the Service Identifier specified in .
tag.remarks: If identical envelope numbers appear with the same date and with the same Service Identifier, records 2-9 must be unchanged from the original. This is not intended to be a sequential serial number reception check.

tag.name: ProductID
tag.desc: Allows a provider to identify subsets of its overall service.
tag.remarks: Used to provide receiving organisation data on which to select, route, or otherwise handle data.

tag.name: EnvelopePriority
tag.desc: Specifies the envelope handling priority and not the editorial urgency (see 2:10, ).
tag.remarks: '1' indicates the most urgent, '5' the normal urgency, and '8' the least urgent copy. The numeral '9' indicates a User Defined Priority. The numeral '0' is reserved for future use.

tag.name: DateSent
tag.desc: Indicates year, month and day the service sent the material.

tag.name: TimeSent
tag.desc: This is the time the service sent the material.
tag.remarks: This property should be stored in HHMMSS+HHMM format. When IPTC value was originally stored in HHMMSS format it can be red as well (but it's IPTC IIM standard violation).
tag.version: Values in HHMMSS format can be read.

tag.name: CodedCharacterSet
tag.desc: Array of bytes consisting of one or more control functions used for the announcement, invocation or designation of coded character sets. The control functions follow the ISO 2022 standard and may consist of the escape control character and one or more graphic characters. For more details see Appendix C, the IPTC-NAA Code Library.

remarks.para: The control functions apply to character oriented DataSets in records 2-6. They also apply to record 8, unless the objectdata explicitly, or the File Format implicitly, defines character sets otherwise.

If this DataSet contains the designation function for Unicode in UTF-8 then no other announcement, designation or invocation functions are permitted in this DataSet or in records 2-6. For all other character sets, one or more escape sequences are used:

list.item: for the announcement of the code extension facilities used in the data which follows,
for the initial designation of the G0, G1, G2 and G3 graphic character sets and

for the initial invocation of the graphic set (7 bits) or the lefthand and the right-hand graphic set (8 bits) and for the initial invocation of the C0 (7 bits) or of the C0 and the C1 control character sets (8 bits).

remarks.para: The announcement of the code extension facilities, if transmitted, must appear in this data set. Designation and invocation of graphic and control function sets (shifting) may be transmitted anywhere where the escape and the other necessary control characters are permitted. However, it is recommended to transmit in this DataSet an initial designation and invocation, i.e. to define all designations and the shift status currently in use by transmitting the appropriate escape sequences and locking-shift functions.
If is omitted, the default for records 2-6 and 8 is ISO 646 IRV (7 bits) or ISO 4873 DV (8 bits). Record 1 shall always use ISO 646 IRV or ISO 4873 DV respectively.

ECMA as the ISO Registration Authority for escape sequences maintains the International Register of Coded Character Sets to be used with escape sequences, a register of Codes and allocated standardised escape sequences, which are recognised by IPTC-NAA without further approval procedure. The registration procedure is defined in ISO 2375. IPTC-NAA maintain a Register of Codes and allocated private escape sequences, which are shown in paragraph 1.2. IPTC may, as Sponsoring Authority, submit such private sequence Codes for approval as standardised sequence Codes. The registers consist of a Graphic repertoire, a Control function repertoire and a Repertoire of other coding systems (e.g. complete Codes). Together they represent the IPTC-NAA Code Library.

item.description: NATS Primary Set for Finland and Sweden 4/3
NATS Secondary Set for Finland and Sweden 4/4
NATS Primary Set for Denmark and Norway 4/5
NATS Secondary Set for Denmark and Norway 4/6
Alternate Primary Graphic Set No. 1 (Canada CSA Z 243.4-1985) 7/7
Alternate Primary Graphic Set No. 2 (Canada CSA Z 243.4-1985) 7/8
Right-hand Part of Latin Alphabet No. 1 (ISO 8859-1) 4/1
Right-hand Part of Latin Alphabet No. 2 (ISO 8859-2) 4/2
Right-hand Part of Latin Alphabet No. 3 (ISO 8859-3) 4/3
Right-hand Part of Latin Alphabet No. 4 (ISO 8859-4) 4/4

list.listheader: Multiple-Byte Graphic Character Sets (1st intermediate character 2/4, 2nd intermediate character 2/8 to 2/11)

item.description: IPTC C0 Set for newspaper text transmission 4/3
C0 Set of ISO 646 with SS2 instead of IS4 4/4

list.listheader: Repertoire of Other Coding Systems (e.g. complete Codes, intermediate character 2/5 )

remarks.note: What's mentioned above is from definition of IPTC standard. This class currently does not support all encodings that can be advertised here neither it supports changes of encodings using ISO 2022 mechanism anywhere in text. Only certain encodings are supported - see the property for details.

tag.version: Added limited support for UTF-8 based encoding autodetection based on value of this dataset.

tag.name: UNO
tag.desc: UNO Unique Name of Object, providing eternal, globally unique identification for objects as specified in the IIM, independent of provider and for any media form.
tag.remarks: The provider must ensure the UNO is unique. Objects with the same UNO are identical.

item.name: MTI
item.desc: Magyar Távirati Iroda / Hungarian News Agency

tag.name: ARMIdentifier
tag.desc: The DataSet identifies the Abstract Relationship Method (ARM) which is described in a document registered by the originator of the ARM with the IPTC and NAA.

tag.name: ARMVersion
tag.desc: A number representing the particular version of the ARM specified in DataSet <see cref='ARMIdentifier'/>.

item.name: IPTCMethod1
item.desc: Using DataSets 2:45, 2:47 and 2:50 (<see cref='ReferenceService'/>, <see cref='ReferenceDate'/> and <see cref='ReferenceNumber'/>)

record.name: Application
record.desc: This record contain informative data about content. Whole record is optional, but when any tag is used then mandatory tags are mandatory.

tag.name: RecordVersion
tag.desc: A number identifying the version of the Information Interchange Model, Part II (Record 2:xx), utilised by the provider.
tag.remarks: Version numbers are assigned by IPTC and NAA. The version number of this record is four (4).

tag.name: ObjectTypeReference
tag.desc: The Object Type is used to distinguish between different types of objects within the IIM.
tag.remarks: The first part is a number representing a language independent international reference to an Object Type followed by a colon separator. The second part, if used, is a text representation of the Object Type Number (maximum 64 octets) consisting of graphic characters plus spaces either in English, as defined in Appendix G, or in the language of the service as indicated in DataSet 2:135 (<see cref='LanguageIdentifier'/>)

enum.name: ObjectTypes
enum.desc: Object Type Number and Object Type Name relationship

item.name: Data
item.desc: Data. Data in this context implies typically non narrative information, usually not eligible for journalistic intervention or modification. It also applies to information routed by the provider from a third party to the user. Examples are sports results, stock prices and agate.

tag.name: ObjectAttributeReference
tag.desc: The Object Attribute defines the nature of the object independent of the Subject.
tag.remarks: The first part is a number representing a language independent international reference to an Object Attribute followed by a colon separator. The second part, if used, is a text representation of the Object Attribute Number ( maximum 64 octets) consisting of graphic characters plus spaces either in English, as defined in Appendix G, or in the language of the service as indicated in DataSet 2:135 (<see cref='LanguageIdentifier'/>)

enum.name: ObjectAttributes
enum.desc: Object Attribute Number abd Object Name relationship

tag.name: ObjectName
tag.desc: Used as a shorthand reference for the object. Changes to existing data, such as updated stories or new crops on photos, should be identified in Edit Status.

tag.name: EditStatus
tag.desc: Status of the objectdata, according to the practice of the provider.

tag.name: EditorialUpdate
tag.desc: Indicates the type of update that this object provides to a previous object. The link to the previous object is made using the ARM (DataSets 1:120 and 1:122 (<see cref='ARM'/>)), according to the practices of the provider.

item.name: AdditionalLanguage
item.desc: Additional language. Signifies that the accompanying Record 2 DataSets repeat information from another object in a different natural language (as indicated by DataSet 2:135 - <see cref='LanguageIdentifier'/>).

tag.name: Urgency
tag.desc: Specifies the editorial urgency of content and not necessarily the envelope handling priority (see 1:60, ).
tag.remarks: The '1' is most urgent, '5' normal and '8' denotes the least-urgent copy. The numerals '9' and '0' are reserved for future use.

tag.name: SubjectReference
tag.desc: The Subject Reference is a structured definition of the subject matter.
tag.remarks: It must contain an IPR (default value is "IPTC"), an 8 digit Subject Reference Number and an optional Subject Name, Subject Matter Name and Subject Detail Name. Each part of the Subject reference is separated by a colon (:). The Subject Reference Number contains three parts, a 2 digit Subject Number, a 3 digit Subject Matter Number and a 3 digit Subject Detail Number thus providing unique identification of the object's subject.

enum.name: SubjectReferenceNumbers
enum.desc: Subject Reference Number and Subject Name relationship (version IPTC/1)

item.name: ArtsCultureEntertainment
item.desc: Matters pertaining to the advancement and refinement of the human mind, of interests, skills, tastes and emotions

item.name: CrimeLawJustice
item.desc: Establishment and/or statement of the rules of behaviour in society, the enforcement of these rules, breaches of the rules and the punishment of offenders. Organisations and bodies involved in these activities.

item.name: DisastersAccidents
item.desc: Man made and natural events resulting in loss of life or injury to living creatures and/or damage to inanimate objects or property.

item.name: EconomyBusinessFinance
item.desc: All matters concerning the planning, production and exchange of wealth.

item.name: Education
item.desc: All aspects of furthering knowledge of human individuals from birth to death.

item.name: EnvironmentalIssues
item.desc: All aspects of protection, damage, and condition of the ecosystem of the planet earth and its surroundings.

item.name: Health
item.desc: All aspects pertaining to the physical and mental welfare of human beings.

item.name: HumanInterest
item.desc: Lighter items about individuals, groups, animals or objects.

item.name: Labour
item.desc: Social aspects, organisations, rules and conditions affecting the employment of human effort for the generation of wealth or provision of services and the economic support of the unemployed.

item.name: LifestyleAndLeisure
item.desc: Activities undertaken for pleasure, relaxation or recreation outside paid employment, including eating and travel.

item.name: Politics
item.desc: Local, regional, national and international exercise of power, or struggle for power, and the relationships between governing bodies and states.

item.name: ReligionBelief
item.desc: All aspects of human existence involving theology, philosophy, ethics and spirituality.

item.name: ScienceTechnology
item.desc: All aspects pertaining to human understanding of nature and the physical world and the development and application of this knowledge

item.name: SocialIssues
item.desc: Aspects of the behaviour of humans affecting the quality of life.

item.name: Sport
item.desc: Competitive exercise involving physical effort. Organisations and bodies involved in these activities.

item.name: UnrestConflictsWar
item.desc: Acts of socially or politically motivated protest and/or violence.

item.name: Weather
item.desc: The study, reporting and predic meteorological phenomena.

enum.name: SubjectMatterNumbers
enum.desc: Subject Matter Name and Subject Reference Number relationship

enum.name: EconomySubjectDetail
enum.desc: Subject Detail Name and Subject Refrence Number relationship (Economy, Business & Finnance)

tag.name: Category
tag.attributes: <Obsolete("Use of this DataSet is Deprecated. It is likely that this DataSet will not be included in further versions of the IIM.")>
tag.desc: Identifies the subject of the objectdata in the opinion of the provider.
tag.remarks: A list of categories will be maintained by a regional registry, where available, otherwise by the provider.

tag.name: SupplementalCategory
tag.attributes: <Obsolete("Use of this DataSet is Deprecated. It is likely that this DataSet will not be included in further versions of the IIM.")>
tag.desc: Supplemental categories further refine the subject of an objectdata.
tag.remarks: Only a single supplemental category may be contained in each DataSet. A supplemental category may include any of the recognised categories as used in . Otherwise, selection of supplemental categories are left to the provider.

tag.name: FixtureIdentifier
tag.desc: Identifies objectdata that recurs often and predictably.
tag.remarks: Enables users to immediately find or recall such an object.

tag.name: Keywords
tag.desc: Used to indicate specific information retrieval words.
tag.remarks: Each keyword uses a single Keywords DataSet. Multiple keywords use multiple Keywords DataSets. It is expected that a provider of various types of data that are related in subject matter uses the same keyword, enabling the receiving system or subsystems to search across all types of data for related material.

group.name: ContentLocation
group.desc: Country/geographical location referenced by the content of the object

tag.name: ContentLocationCode
tag.desc: Indicates the code of a country/geographical location referenced by the content of the object.
tag.remarks: Where ISO has established an appropriate country code under ISO 3166, that code will be used. When ISO3166 does not adequately provide for identification of a location or a country, e.g. ships at sea, space, IPTC will assign an appropriate threecharacter code under the provisions of ISO3166 to avoid conflicts. (see Appendix D) .

tag.name: ContentLocationName
tag.desc: Provides a full, publishable name of a country/geographical location referenced by the content of the object, according to guidelines of the provider.
tag.remarks: If used in the same object with DataSet , must immediately follow and correspond to it.

senum.name: ISO3166
senum.desc: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 codes used by with addition of some spacial codes used there.
senum.remarks: Reserved code elements are codes which, while not ISO 3166-1 codes, are in use for some applications in conjunction with the ISO 3166 codes. The ISO 3166/MA therefore reserves them, so that they are not used for new official ISO 3166 codes, thereby creating conflicts between the standard and those applications.

item.name: Zaire
item.desc: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the[1]

item.name: SouthGeorgiaAndTheSouthSandwichIslands
item.human-name: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
item.desc: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

item.name: Ascension
item.desc: Ascension Island — Reserved on request of UPU, also used by ITU

item.name: Clipperton
item.desc: Clipperton Island — Reserved on request of ITU

item.name: DiegoGarcia
item.desc: Diego Garcia — Reserved on request of ITU

item.name: FranceMetropolitan
item.desc: France, Metropolitan — Reserved on request of France

item.name: TristanDaCunha
item.desc: Tristan da Cunha — Reserved on request of UPU

item.name: EuropeanUnion
item.desc: European Union (formerly known as the EC and before that the EEC)

item.name: England
item.desc: England (where greater granularity than Great Britain is desired)

tag.name: ReleaseDate
tag.desc: The earliest date the provider intends the object to be used.

tag.name: ReleaseTime
tag.desc: The earliest time the provider intends the object to be used.
tag.remarks: This property should be stored in HHMMSS+HHMM format. When IPTC value was originally stored in HHMMSS format it can be red as well (but it's IPTC IIM standard violation).
tag.version: Values in HHMMSS format can be read.

tag.name: ExpirationDate
tag.desc: The latest date the provider or owner intends the objectdata to be used.

tag.name: ExpirationTime
tag.desc: The latest time the provider or owner intends the objectdata to be used.
tag.remarks: This property should be stored in HHMMSS+HHMM format. When IPTC value was originally stored in HHMMSS format it can be red as well (but it's IPTC IIM standard violation).
tag.version: Values in HHMMSS format can be read.

tag.name: SpecialInstructions
tag.desc: Other editorial instructions concerning the use of the objectdata, such as embargoes and warnings.

tag.name: ActionAdvised
tag.desc: Indicates the type of action that this object provides to a previous object.
tag.remarks: The link to the previous object is made using the (DataSets 1:120 () and 1:122 ()), according to the practices of the provider.

item.name: ObjectKill
item.desc: Object Kill. Signifies that the provider wishes the holder of a copy of the referenced object make no further use of that information and take steps to prevent further distribution thereof.
item.remarks: Implies that any use of the object might result in embarrassment or other exposure of the provider and/or recipient.

item.name: ObjectReplace
item.desc: Object Replace. Signifies that the provider wants to replace the referenced object with the object provided under the current envelope.

item.name: ObjectAppend
item.desc: Object Append. Signifies that the provider wants to append to the referenced object information provided in the objectdata of the current envelope.

item.name: ObjectReference
item.desc: Object Reference. Signifies that the provider wants to make reference to objectdata in a different envelope.

group.name: Reference
group.desc: Identifies a prior envelope to which the current object refers.
group.remarks: Indicate that the current object refers to the content of a prior envelope.

tag.name: ReferenceService
tag.desc: Identifies the Service Identifier of a prior envelope to which the current object refers.

tag.name: ReferenceDate
tag.desc: Identifies the date of a prior envelope to which the current object refers.

tag.name: ReferenceNumber
tag.desc: Identifies the Envelope Number of a prior envelope to which the current object refers.

tag.name: DateCreated
tag.desc: The date the intellectual content of the objectdata was created rather than the date of the creation of the physical representation.
tag.remarks: Thus a photo taken during the American Civil War would carry a creation date during that epoch (1861-1865) rather than the date the photo was digitised for archiving.

tag.name: TimeCreated
tag.desc: The time the intellectual content of the objectdata current source material was created rather than the creation of the physical representation.
tag.remarks:
Where the time cannot be precisely determined, the closest approximation should be used.
This property should be stored in HHMMSS+HHMM format. When IPTC value was originally stored in HHMMSS format it can be red as well (but it's IPTC IIM standard violation).
tag.version: Values in HHMMSS format can be read.

tag.name: DigitalCreationDate
tag.desc: The date the digital representation of the objectdata was created.
tag.remarks: Thus a photo taken during the American Civil War would carry a Digital Creation Date within the past several years rather than the date where the image was captured on film, glass plate or other substrate during that epoch (1861-1865).

tag.name: DigitalCreationTime
tag.desc: The time the digital representation of the objectdata was created.
tag.remarks: This property should be stored in HHMMSS+HHMM format. When IPTC value was originally stored in HHMMSS format it can be red as well (but it's IPTC IIM standard violation).
tag.version: Values in HHMMSS format can be read.

tag.name: OriginatingProgram
tag.desc: Identifies the type of program used to originate the objectdata.
tag.remarks: Note: This DataSet to form an advisory to the user and are not "computer" fields. Programmers should not expect to find computer-readable information in this DataSet.

tag.name: ProgramVersion
tag.desc: Identifies the type of program used to originate the objectdata.
tag.remarks: Note: This DataSet to form an advisory to the user and are not "computer" fields. Programmers should not expect to find computer-readable information in this DataSet.

tag.name: ObjectCycle
tag.desc: Virtually only used in North America.

tag.name: ByLine
tag.desc: Contains name of the creator of the objectdata, e.g. writer, photographer or graphic artist.

tag.name: ByLineTitle
tag.desc: A by-line title is the title of the creator or creators of an objectdata. Where used, a by-line title should follow the by-line it modifies.
tag.remarks: Examples: "Staff Photographer", "Corresponsal", "Envoyé Spécial"

tag.name: City
tag.desc: Identifies city of objectdata origin according to guidelines established by the provider.

tag.name: SubLocation
tag.desc: Identifies the location within a city from which the objectdata originates, according to guidelines established by the provider.

tag.name: ProvinceState
tag.desc: Identifies Province/State of origin according to guidelines established by the provider.

tag.name: CountryPrimaryLocationCode
tag.desc: Indicates the code of the country/primary location where the intellectual property of the objectdata was created, e.g. a photo was taken, an event occurred.
tag.remarks: Where ISO has established an appropriate country code under ISO 3166, that code will be used. When ISO3166 does not adequately provide for identification of a location or a new country, e.g. ships at sea, space, IPTC will assign an appropriate three-character code under the provisions of ISO3166 to avoid conflicts. (see Appendix D)

tag.name: CountryPrimaryLocationName
tag.desc: Provides full, publishable, name of the country/primary location where the intellectual property of the objectdata was created, according to guidelines of the provider.

tag.name: OriginalTransmissionReference
tag.desc: A code representing the location of original transmission according to practices of the provider.
tag.remarks: Examples: BER-5, PAR-12-11-01

tag.name: Headline
tag.desc: A publishable entry providing a synopsis of the contents of the objectdata.

tag.name: Credit
tag.desc: Identifies the provider of the objectdata, not necessarily the owner/creator.

tag.name: Source
tag.desc: Identifies the original owner of the intellectual content of the objectdata.
tag.remarks: This could be an agency, a member of an agency or an individual.

tag.name: CopyrightNotice
tag.desc: Contains any necessary copyright notice.

tag.name: Contact
tag.desc: Identifies the person or organisation which can provide further background information on the objectdata.

tag.name: CaptionAbstract
tag.desc: A textual description of the objectdata, particularly used where the object is not text.

tag.name: WriterEditor
tag.desc: Identification of the name of the person involved in the writing, editing or correcting the objectdata or caption/abstract.

tag.name: RasterizedeCaption
tag.desc: Image width 460 pixels and image height 128 pixels. Scanning direction bottom to top, left to right.
tag.remarks: Contains the rasterized objectdata description and is used where characters that have not been coded are required for the caption.

tag.name: ImageType
tag.desc: Image Type

enum.name: ImageTypeComponents
enum.desc: Number of components in image and special meanings of some numbers

item.name: SuplementaryData
item.desc: the objectdata contains supplementary data to an image

senum.name: ImageTypeContents
senum.desc: Exact content of the current objectdata in terms of colour composition.

tag.name: ImageOrientation
tag.desc: Indicates the layout of the image area.

tag.name: LanguageIdentifier
tag.desc: Describes the major national language of the object, according to the 2-letter codes of ISO 639:1988.
tag.remarks: Does not define or imply any coded character set, but is used for internal routing, e.g. to various editorial desks. Implementation note: Programmers should provide for three octets for Language Identifier because the ISO is expected to provide for 3-letter codes in the future.

tag.name: AudioType
tag.desc: Type of audio in objectdata
tag.remarks: Note: When '0' or 'T' is used, the only authorised combination is "0T". This is the mechanism for sending a caption either to supplement an audio cut sent previously without a caption or to correct a previously sent caption.

senum.name: AudioDataType
senum.desc: The exact type of audio contained in the current objectdata.

tag.name: AudioSamplingRate
tag.desc: Sampling rate, representing the sampling rate in hertz (Hz).

tag.name: AudioSamplingResolution
tag.desc: The number of bits in each audio sample.

tag.name: AudioDuration
tag.desc: The running time of an audio objectdata when played back at the speed at which it was recorded.

tag.name: AudioOutcue
tag.desc: Identifies the content of the end of an audio objectdata, according to guidelines established by the provider.
tag.remarks: The outcue generally consists of the final words spoken within an audio objectdata or the final sounds heard.

tag.name: ObjectDataPreviewFileFormat
tag.desc: The file format of the ObjectData Preview.
tag.remarks: The file format must be registered with IPTC or NAA with a unique number assigned to it.

tag.name: ObjectDataPreviewFileFormatVersion
tag.desc: The particular version of the ObjectData Preview File Format specified in
tag.remarks: The File Format Version is taken from the list included in Appendix A

tag.name: ObjectDataPreviewData
tag.desc: Maximum size of 256000 octets consisting of binary data.

record.name: PreObjectDataDescriptorRecord
record.desc: Information about ObjectData (before object has been sent)

tag.name: SizeMode
tag.desc: The octet is set to the binary value of '0' if the size of the objectdata is not known and is set to '1' if the size of the objectdata is known at the beginning of transfer.

tag.name: MaxSubfileSize
tag.desc: The maximum size for the following Subfile DataSet(s).
tag.remarks: The largest number is not defined, but programmers should provide at least for the largest binary number contained in four octets taken together. If the entire object is to be transferred together within a single DataSet 8:10, the number equals the size of the object.

tag.name: ObjectDataSizeAnnounced
tag.desc: A binary number representing the overall size of the objectdata, expressed in octets, not including tags, if that size is known when transfer commences.
tag.remarks: Mandatory if DataSet has value '1' and not allowed if DataSet has value '0'.

tag.name: MaximumObjectDataSize
tag.desc: Used when objectdata size is not known, indicating the largest size, expressed in octets, that the objectdata can possibly have, not including tags.

tag.name: Subfile
tag.desc: Subfile DataSet containing the objectdata itself.
tag.remarks: Subfiles must be sequential so that the subfiles may be reassembled.

tag.name: ConfirmedObjectDataSize
tag.desc: Total size of the objectdata, in octets, without tags.
tag.remarks: This number should equal the number in DataSet if the size of the objectdata is known and has been provided.
